js
Class JSStepper

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              js.JSStepper
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.FocusListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener
public class JSStepper
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.FocusListener

JSStepper is an alternative to JSpinner. It provides a text field to hold the current value, and two buttons to increment and decrement the value. A minimum and maximum value can be set, as well as the increment value, i.e. the amount the value increases when incrementing the value.

Version:
1.1.1
Author:
Josh Sunshine
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

JSStepper

public JSStepper(int max)
Creates a new JSStepper with the specified maximum value. The initial and minimum values will be 0, and the increment will be 1.

Parameters:
max - the maximum value for this JSStepper

JSStepper

public JSStepper(int min,
                 int max)
Creates a new JSStepper with the specified maximum and minimum values. The initial value will be 0, and the increment will be 1.

Parameters:
min - the minimum value for this JSStepper
max - the maximum value for this JSStepper

JSStepper

public JSStepper(int min,
                 int max,
                 int initialValue)
Creates a new JSStepper with the specified maximum and minimum values, and the specified initial value. The increment will be 1.

Parameters:
min - the minimum value for this JSStepper
max - the maximum value for this JSStepper
initialValue - the initial value for this JSStepper

JSStepper

public JSStepper(int min,
                 int max,
                 int increment,
                 int initialValue)
Creates a new JSStepper with the specified maximum, minimum and initial values, and the specified increment.

Parameters:
min - the minimum value for this JSStepper
max - the maximum value for this JSStepper
increment - the amount the value should be incremented when the increment button is clicked
initialValue - the initial value for this JSStepper
Method Detail

setTypingAllowed

public void setTypingAllowed(java.lang.Boolean allowed)
Sets whether the keyboard can be used to type a specific value, or whether the mouse must be used. Even when typing is not allowed, using the arrow keys still increments or decrements the value, i.e. setTypingAllowed only affects whether or not values can be typed in directly.

Parameters:
allowed - If true, the keyboard can be used to type a specific value. If false, the mouse must be used to change the value using the buttons.

setFont

public void setFont(java.awt.Font font)
Sets the font for the text field of this JSStepper.

Overrides:
setFont in class javax.swing.JComponent
Parameters:
font - the font to use for the text field.

increment

public void increment()
Increments the current value by the increment value set at initialisation.

decrement

public void decrement()
Decrements the current value by the increment value set at initialisation.

setValue

public void setValue(int value)
Sets the current value to a specific integer. If the value parameter is less than min then the value will be set to min, or if the value is greater than max it will be set to max.

Parameters:
value - the value to set this JSStepper to

getValue

public int getValue()
Determines the current value of this JSStepper

Returns:
the current value of the stepper.

setIncrement

public void setIncrement(int increment)
Sets the amount that value should change by when increment() or decrement are called.

Parameters:
increment - the new value to increment by

setMax

public void setMax(int max)
Sets the maximum allowed value for this stepper.

Parameters:
max - the new maximum value allowed
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the max value is smaller than the current min value

setMin

public void setMin(int min)
Sets the minimum allowed value for this stepper.

Parameters:
min - the new minimum value allowed
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the min value is greater than the current max value
